quote: Yes...
You coming?
I'm sorry, I was... nevermind...
Dammit. Not yet...
Deep Space Nine, this is Valerian vessel Sherval Das. We are entering the Bajoran system, clear us for docking.
Negative, Sherval Das. There's going to be a slight delay.
We are in need of maintenance. It has been a long journey.
I'm sure it has. But we've got our own problems. You'll just have to wait --
Stand by, Sherval Das.
I'd like an explanation.
I'm not finished running the background check on their ship.
We agreed there'd be no delays in the docking procedure --

They just visited Fahleena Three and Mariah Four -- the same two stops they used to make when they were running dolamide to the Cardassians. The last stop would be the purification plant on Ultima Thule.
If I can place them there, we'll know they're carrying weapons-grade material.
Your ship is cleared for docking.
Thank you, Commander. Sherval Das out.
No delays...
Isn't it always the same old story? I hear it day in, day out. She takes you for granted. She doesn't appreciate your... finer qualities.
The cut of your jib... The twist of your tulamak...
The way you turn a phrase... What does she want?
Two Pistres? For all my compassion? You call that a tip? No wonder she left you! You piker!
Trouble, Quark?
Nothing I can't handle.
I heard you had some problems with the Klingons the last time they came through...
Spare me from beings who think pain is pleasure. In small doses, perhaps. But the Klingons? They're rough on the holosuites. They break the furniture.
I'm still fixing the walls in Holosuite Six. I'm not saying they don't spend big. I'm just saying by the time you figure in the damage, I'm lucky to break even.
They do tend toward bluster, don't they? Throwing their weight around. Bragging...
This crew was worse than the last. "Our glorious mission." I asked them, "what's so glorious about a gamma quadrant bio-survey?"
And what did they say?
Crafty tonight, aren't we, Odo? Looking for clues about the fate of the Klingons. If I tell you what I heard, what do I get in return?
Chances are, what you heard won't help. So why should I give you something for it?
Because otherwise, I heard nothing.
Those damaged holosuites. Work crew seven is probably doing the repairs, am I right?
Yes...
Well, it looks as though I might have to put in a priority request for work crew seven. The bulkheads in security could use a little shoring up.
They said they were coming back through the wormhole with something that would "make the enemies of the Klingon Empire tremble."
Their exact words?
A direct quote.
You've been most helpful.
Don't let it get around.
Odo?
Doctor Bashir! Doctor Bashir!
Welcome back, Constable.
How am I?
How do you feel?
Fine.
Good. Because I've got no way to know. Your body chemistry defies analysis.
I don't remember anything...
But, I'm back to normal?
Like I said -- you tell me. I don't know what caused it, and I couldn't tell you if it'll happen again. There's really nothing more I can do here.
Then thank you for your time, Doctor.
Tell me Odo, do you share my concern about this Valerian situation?
Concern?
I think you know what I mean.
Why don't you tell me and then you can be sure I know.
Just don't be surprised if the uneasy alliance on this station starts to show a few cracks...
What "uneasy alliance"?
Commander Sisko and Kira. Mark my words, there's going to be trouble.
Exactly what are you basing all this on, Doctor?
Very clever, Constable. (a conspiratorial nod) You're probably right. It's still too early to commit oneself either way.
Are you finished with me?
Unless you'd like to pour yourself through my phoretic analyzer -- I'd love to see the results.
Another time, perhaps.
I've got them!
Who?
The Valerians. Their ship was at the Ultima Thule station one week ago. That confirms it. They're definitely running dolamide.
So I've got an armed team ready to board their vessel. We confiscate the material and send them back where they came from. Frankly, I'm half tempted to take them to Bajor and press charges.
By whose authority?
You're not going to do anything about this?
I'm not. And neither are you.
Commanded by a Federation officer. Commanded by me. Are you challenging that, Major?
No, Sir...
Good... Now is there anything else I can do for you?
Short-range sensors are picking up some debris.
Looks like duranium alloy. Probably pieces of the Klingon's secondary hull.
It's possible their mission recorder is somewhere in the debris. The magnetic field from the duranium could be masking it.
Let's get a little closer...
Major Kira's been awfully aggressive toward Commander Sisko lately... about station policy.
An honest difference of opinion.
We're within a thousand meters... Secondary hull fragments, pieces of the bulkhead... Still no sign of the recorder.
I'm taking us closer...
What if it's more than a difference of opinion? What if Kira thinks the Bajorans don't need us on DS Nine? It is their station.
That would be suicidal. Without a Federation presence Bajor would be vulnerable again to the Cardassians.
That doesn't mean there aren't plenty of misguided Bajorans who think they can go it alone.

Isn't it always like that? Bitterness is the coin by which generosity is repaid. I once helped the Federation deliver rain-inducing technology to Kelton Four. The end of the drought was the end of contact. Talk about fair weather friends --
You've become quite friendly with Major Kira, haven't you?
Have I... ? Well, yes, I suppose I have... if you say so...
Well, I wouldn't get too friendly with the natives if I were you. Remember where your loyalties lie.
Of course. Benjamin and I have been close for a long time. Hand and glove. I'm on his side -- no question about it. That reminds me of the time we found ourselves --
Good. Because anyone against Sisko is against me.
I'm picking up a weak subspace transponder signal.
It's the mission recorder.
Constable...
Can I help you, Major?
You always manage to help me, Odo. In fact, I'd say we work pretty well together -- you and I.
Yes. I suppose our relationship has always been... cooperative.
Exactly. And that's just what I need right now -- your cooperation.
I'm convinced the Valerians have dolamide on board. But the evidence is still circumstantial. I need solid proof. I want you to slip past their security systems and into their cargo bay.
I heard Commander Sisko was adamant about not interfering with the Valerian ship. Has he changed his mind?
Yes.
How odd.
Very well. I'll keep the two of you informed of my progress.
That's not necessary. The Commander's busy -- no sense in bothering him.
I can't fool you, Odo.
You wanted me to go behind Sisko's back, didn't you?
Forget it. It was a bad idea.
What if you had to choose sides? Just remember who your friends are.
Personal log, Miles O'Brien. Stardate 46923.1. We've managed to retrieve a portion of the Klingon Officer's journal. Of course, Major Kira heard about it immediately. She must have spies everywhere.

I believe the Captain has gone insane. He has executed two more crew members, charging them with attempted mutiny. Medical Officer Kee-Bhor came to my quarters insisting the violence is being caused by those telepathic energy spheres we brought back from Saltah'na. Believing he's the Captain's spy, I slit his throat.
I've seen enough.
There's more.
The Klingon's mission must have failed... and that failure caused problems on board...
I couldn't care less what happened to a Klingon ship.
The Klingons might want to know. Dax and I are setting up a data interpolation to fill in what's missing -- but it'll take some time...
The search itself is often reward enough. Benjamin, do you remember that wild goose chase back on Elanu Four... ?
Fine. Do whatever you have to do, but don't bother me with it.
Here we are. A Modela aperitif. It's bright and sweet. Much like yourself, Lieutenant. I'll put it on your tab.
The bad flattery is on the house.
The two loveliest creatures on DS Nine. I must be living correctly to be so... blessed. What can I do for you, Major?
Get lost.
As you wish...
How are you, Lieutenant?
You know what they say -- put the shoe on the right foot first, but put the left foot first into the bathtub.
I understand.
But what I really meant was... Are you happy?
That's not a question I get asked too often.
Oh, but it should be. In my opinion, you're the most valuable officer on this station. May I... ?
Please.
Not bad. For Quark.
It is good...
I couldn't imagine running this station without you.
Are you trying to tell me something?
My disagreement with Sisko about the Valerians is no secret. You know how he gets once he makes a decision.
Like talking to a stone. I remember a time on Rochani Three... We were cornered by a party of Kaleans who were not at all happy to see us. But Benjamin --
-- You told me that story this morning.
Oh. I suppose I did...
If you were to talk to Starfleet Command... tell them how displeased the Bajorans are with Sisko's handling of this... I'm sure they'd listen to you...
I was decorated on my very first assignment. The Admiral was a Vulcan... So during the presentation ceremony --
Dax. We have to keep the Valerians here. Until we can search their ship and confiscate the dolamide. You've got to convince Starfleet -- it's for the good of Bajor and the Federation.
I've been friends with Benjamin Sisko for many years... In many ways, he's like a son to me. Or at least a nephew... Some kind of close relative anyway...
Listen to me, Jadzia...
I'm getting rid of Sisko... one way or another. Don't force me to get rid of you as well.
Would you like to join us?
Let me go!
What did you hear?
Nothing! Nothing at all!
Good.
Is this a Ferengi fashion I'm not aware of?
Kira tried to tear my head off. I want to file charges.
Tell me about it.
I heard her plotting --
Go on.
She was trying to convince Dax to take her side against Sisko.
Did Dax seem persuaded?
What difference does that make? I was attacked!
Answer the question.
I couldn't tell. She was on the fence.

Doesn't Kira's behavior seem a little out of the ordinary? And the others... At the staff briefing Sisko was bored -- as if he couldn't be bothered about running the station. And Bashir... since when is he so concerned with station politics.
Don't look at me like that. I'm perfectly normal.
I suppose you are. It's time I had a talk with Sisko.
Odo... wait!
Odo! I want satisfaction.
We have lost the battle for decks five through twelve. The armory remains in the hands of Captain Tel- Peh, who demands my death. But I remain confident that I can gain control of this ship.
Sisko... ?
First officer's mission journal... day twenty-three...
Come in.
Where's Commander Sisko?
In his quarters. Where he's safe.

I am weakened by my wounds. I sense my enemies are closing in. Still, I was able to hide the thalmerite device under a crossbeam near the reactor core on deck twenty-six. Rather than be taken prisoner, I will blow up this ship and transport to safety. Perhaps medical officer Kee-Bhor was right. All our trouble began when we opened those energy spheres. All I know is that Captain Tel-Peh must die. Journal closed.
It sounds like there was a power struggle on board. Some kind of attempted takeover.
Management by mutiny. That's standard operating procedure on a Klingon vessel.
But awfully unusual for a Federation- run space station...
Don't worry, if Major Kira tries anything we'll be ready.
When will the other log entries be available?
At the current rate of processing -- at least seven more hours. But the computer's taking it one entry at a time. I'll set it up so you can access as it goes.
Thank you, Chief.
Of course, Constable. Don't the Commander and I always try to make you happy?
What are you doing here?
Chief O'Brien's orders.
Come in.
Commander...
Hello, Constable. How are you today?
Concerned, Sir.
On such a fine afternoon? How
Commander, I think something might be wrong with -- some of us. Ever since the Klingon ship exploded, and their First Officer beamed over... certain behaviors and attitudes have been... abnormal.
There appears to have been a mutiny on the Klingon ship. I wouldn't go so far as to say the same thing is happening on DS Nine. But I find some disturbing parallels --
-- If something's bothering you, Odo, tell it to Mister O'Brien. That's what he's there for.
What do you think?
What is it?
It's a clock. Fascinating, isn't it?
It's not nice to keep a friend waiting.
Did we have an appointment?
When have I ever had to stand on ceremony with you, Odo?
I need your help. I just took care of the Valerians.
What do you mean?
I locked down the docking clamps. That ship isn't leaving until I say it is. O'Brien will need at least a day to do anything about it. By then, it won't matter.
You're going after Sisko.
And O'Brien. Either we get a more reasonable commander from Starfleet -- somebody we can control -- or we go it alone.

With me running this place, you'll be able to do what needs to be done. If you want to toss Quark out on his ears -- toss him out. If you want to proclaim martial law on the Promenade -- proclaim it. This station will be yours to protect -- with no interference.
What's your plan?
Odo, I trust you more than anyone on this station. Because you can't be corrupted. But this is a dangerous time. I can't take any chances, even with you.
When the moment comes, you'll know it. I'll be counting on you.
Computer, open a channel to Starfleet Headquarters.
Subspace communication to Federation territories is currently unavailable.
Why?
By authority of Major Kira.
Open a channel to the Bajoran Council.
Communication to Bajor is currently unavailable.
By authority of Chief O'Brien?
That is correct.
Computer, are you finished reconstructing the journal of the Klingon First officer.
Data interpolation is complete.
On screen.
Computer... Scan the journal for mention of contact with any alien race.
One entry found.
Play it.

First Officer's journal, day twenty- two. Our exploration of the fifth planet has turned out to be a waste of time. This world is not worthy of a Klingon colony. All we found was a collection of energy spheres which possessed some type of telepathic archive. The spheres described an ancient power struggle that destroyed a race called the Saltah'na.
We will forward these results to our science divisions.
Kira has already locked down the Valerian ship. And she's diverted half the station's systems to her control.
Since when?
An hour ago. I've heard some disturbing rumors from our people on the Promenade. I think she's going to make an attempt on your life.
I want you to arrest them. Kira and every Bajoran officer on this station. I want the names of every sympathizer --
-- That's not a good idea, sir. There are a lot more of them than there are of us. If we tip our hand, it could work against us.
What can we do?
Leave the station.
Never. Get me a phaser. I'll get rid of Kira.
Hear me out, sir... We leave the station. Raise a Federation attack force. And return. And on that day we'll get rid of all your enemies.
How do we proceed?
I need a few more hours to free up the Valerian ship. I've already talked to their Captain. He's more than happy to take us back to Federation space.
Call me as soon as you're ready...
It'll take effect in two minutes. Plenty of time for --
-- For you to get a good night's sleep.
Thank you, Doctor.
Chronic insomnia. I think it's hormonal. So how are you?
I take it you've completed your autopsy of the Klingon.
Of course. You know, Odo, events have been moving rapidly since our last conversation. I'd advise you to choose sides or risk finding yourself without any friends at all.
The Klingon, Doctor, what did you find?
He's still dead, if that's what you mean.
I don't have time for jokes.
Your findings could determine who controls this station.
How?
All in good time... First, tell me about the Klingon...
I found nothing very unusual. The columnar cells in his brain stem... the membrane permeability was off...
What could cause that?
Any number of things.
Could it have something to do with telepathy? The Klingons were studying the telepathic archives of an ancient race.
If those archives were contained within a self-sustaining energy matrix, it could explain the changes in the Klingon's brain.
Could that energy matrix have somehow caused them to re-enact the power struggle that destroyed the Saltah'nans.
Possibly. What are you getting at?
Doctor, I believe the Klingon brought the matrix with him... and everyone in Ops was affected except me... without a humanoid brain, my system rejected it.
An interesting theory, Constable... but I'm certainly not behaving out of the ordinary.
Of course not. But what if you and I are the only two who aren't affected.
I see... and you think we can use that to our advantage.
Exactly.
Tell me your plan.
The first thing we have to do is figure out how to remove the field from everyone affected.
But then we'd lose our advantage.
Would you rather someone blew up the station?
I see your point.
The power to control the energy matrix is the power to control this station.
If I could determine the natural resonance frequencies of the field, I might be able to generate an interference signal of some kind which could force it out.
Do it. I promise, Doctor, you won't regret it.
This reminds me of a game I used to play... It had a maze... What was it called?
I'm through level two. See if you can isolate the security blocks on three.
The Winter Garden...
Lieutenant.
Oh. I'm sorry. I must have been drifting.
Try drifting over here when you get the chance.
What's taking so long, O'Brien?
Almost there, Sir. We've got one more level of security lockouts to break through and the Valerian ship will be ready to go.
Commander, I have the report you asked for on those weapon scanners.
Give it to Mister O'Brien.
I really think you should see this, sir.
Dax to Kira!
Is it Kira?!
Did Kira put you up to this?
No...
I want the truth.
Is that clear?
Let's see how this works...
Put it down... Sir...
Take them.
You were supposed to deactivate the transporter!
I forgot...
Damn it. Kira must have set up a force field to keep us from beaming onto the Valerian ship. The Transporter rerouted us here.
We've got to get to that ship.
Odo's our only chance. He may be able to override the field.
You're sure we can trust him?
I don't see where we have any choice.
Sisko to Odo...
Odo here.
Kira has moved against us. She has Dax on her side... We need your help, Constable. You've got to clear us a path to the Valerian ship.
Take Crossover Bridge One to the Cargo Bay entrance into Docking Port Four. I'll keep it open for you.
Right. Sisko out.
Leave your combadge here.
Don't look so worried, Chief. She hasn't beaten us yet.
Yes, Sir.
They're still in the Airlock Six Corridor...
What could they be doing in there?
Maybe they've given up.
Sisko would rather die... which is fine with me. (a beat, then Kira smiles as she figures it out) They must have taken off their combadges. That's all right. They won't get far.
Somebody's taking out our forcefields...
Whoever it is knows how to override the security codes.
Kira to Odo.
Go ahead, Major.
Whose side are you on, Constable?
Yours, of course.
Really? Then why are you helping Sisko escape?
On the contrary. You'll find him trapped in Cargo Bay Four. Consider it my gift to you.
My apologies. We'll see you there. Kira out.
Well done... you certainly fooled her.
Doctor, we're running out of time.

(attention focused on his console) I'm just about done. I've set up an ionic interference signal in Cargo Bay Four. It's calibrated to lock onto the resonance frequencies of the telepathic field and drive it out of those affected.
What will happen to it then?
It'll remain suspended as long as the interference is in effect.
That's all I need to know. Let's go.
What's wrong?
It won't open.
It's completely locked down. Someone's activated a level five security protocol.
There's only one person on this station besides yourself who has that kind of access.
Odo!
Relax, Commander...
... he'll be here any minute.
So... this is where it all ends.
For you.

You know what disturbs me? The ingratitude. I offered you my help... my kindness... my leadership... and how do you repay me? With betrayal... But you won't get rid of me so easily. You see, unlike you, I understand history. Time will be my greatest ally. My name will blaze like a comet across the stars long after your petty treacheries are forgotten.
But you won't be here to see it.
Major, wait...
I'm glad you two could make it.
Computer! Execute Odo One!
Constable... ?
Everyone grab hold of something.
Welcome back...
Commander's log; Stardate 46924.5. With nothing to contain it, the telepathic matrix has dispersed in space.
Meanwhile I'm happy to report everything and everyone aboard DS Nine has returned to normal.
Come in.
Did you really build that thing?
Apparently so.
Why?
I have no idea.
Major?
I know that none of us were really responsible for our actions... but I still feel like I owe you an apology.
For attempted mutiny.
Well... yes.
I think we'll let it go... this time.
You wanted to see me, Commander?
Actually, what I'd like to see is next month's duty roster...
(holds hands up; in control) You'll have it on your desk first thing in the morning...
That's what you said yesterday.
I know, but I spent all day yesterday...
... talking to Minister Rozahn about irrigating the Trilar Peninsula.
How did you know?
Major, it's hard to keep a secret in Ops... especially when you've been shouting at a monitor for the last two days...
I thought I was keeping it to an angry whisper...
Let's just say your voice carries.
Everytime I talk to one of the ministers I promise myself I won't lose control. But then they give me some stupid bureaucratic excuse why something isn't getting done, and I get so... so...
(completing her sentence) Frustrated.
Commander, I'm way beyond frustrated... Bajor's in trouble... I just want to help.
I can understand that, and I sympathize. As far as I'm concerned you can yell at the provisional government all you want... as long as it doesn't interfere with your duties here on the station.
You're right. I'll get on that report right away.
I'll look forward to reading it.
Quark's been looking for you... he says it's urgent...
Perfect.
I hear you've been trying to get in touch with me...
You hear right. Look around you... does anything seem to be amiss?
(takes in the crowd and Varani) That sonata Varani is playing is lovely... your customers seem to be enjoying him...
Why be modest, Major? They're not just enjoying him -- they're mesmerized by him!
So?
So! While they're being mesmerized, they're not gambling, they're not eating, they're barely drinking. Profits are down across the board!
He just started yesterday...

I monitor my gross income hourly. My hourly figures become my indicators. My indicators become my projections. And my projections based on the last twenty-six hours show an unprecedented decline in profits.
Stop overreacting. When people hear about how wonderful Varani is, they'll come beating down your door...
And what are you basing that projection on? Bajoran intuition? That and a strip of latinum will get you a couple of spins at the dabo wheel.
You promised me you'd try him out for a month...
If my projections hold true, in a month I'll be out of business!
Quark, you're going to do this...
Why should I?
Because I asked you to.
Maybe he could play something with a little more... bounce to it...
Bounce...
Just for a change of pace...
That was beautiful...
Having my work appreciated again... I almost forgot how it felt.
Granted, it's not quite the exhibition halls you're used to...
One can't be choosy about performance venues these days.
I just spoke to Quark. He likes what you're doing... but he's hoping you'll play a variety of styles...
A little less exhibition hall and a little more music hall... is that it?
Something like that.
I think I can accommodate him.
I'd love to hear you play in a more appropriate setting...
Mahve you spoken to Minister Bolka about my idea to rebuild the Jalanda Forum?
I mentioned it to him... (admitting to Bolka's resistance) He's got a lot of things on his mind...
You must keep trying. Bajorans must reclaim their artistic heritage if they ever hope to regain their sense of self-worth.
Next time I talk to the Minister, I'll bring it up again... but I can't promise anything.
I have faith in you, Kira. By fighting for this, you're not just a champion of the arts. You're my champion.
Did you get everything settled with Quark?
That little toad is this far from doing a three-sixty out an airlock...
I'm glad to hear everything went okay...
Commander, sensors are picking up elevated neutrino readings. A ship's coming through the wormhole...
On screen.
Sensors are detecting four lifeforms on board...
I'm reading a plasma leak in their engine core...
Hail them.
(hitting a panel; beat) They're not responding...
Their reactors are overheating. Life support is barely functioning...
Get them out of there, Chief.
Aye, sir.
I'm Commander Sisko of the United Federation of Planets. You've just been beamed onto a Bajoran space station. We don't mean you any harm...
We're going to bring your ship in. Once it's docked, we'll be able to diagnose its problems and hopefully fix them. After that, you can be on your way.
(to Tumak, points to Tumak's hand) I can offer you medical assistance for that wound...
Oo-mata! Oo-mata! Dongo patar meeoto fenta. Fenta!
Naga dentana... oobay a-tal. Oobay a-tal! Keetama sootay. Shalanta Skrreea.
Does anyone understand what she's saying...
There must be something wrong with the Universal Translator. Chief?

It's working, Commander... but for some reason it's having a hard analyzing their language patterns... their syntax and grammatical structure must be completely unlike anything we have in our database...
We'll have to keep them talking until the computer can establish a translation matrix.
Ketoh maseeca. Skrreea. Tolak mayfessaka. Koo masek. Gadoux besoolin fenta. Fenta?
Keeping them talking doesn't seem to be a problem...
Oobay-a-tal? Fidask setoma meeka?
Major, we need to get these people to the Infirmary. They seem to be most comfortable with you. Why don't you lead the way?
All right... we're going to go for a little ride in the turbolift...
Toma. Bessa!
Sisko to Odo.
Yes, Commander.
We're bringing some new arrivals from the Gamma Quadrant down to the Promenade. Meet us at Turbolift Nine.
I'm on my way.
We're here... you can come out now... (a friendly beckoning wave) There's no need to be afraid...
What seems to be the trouble, Commander?
The computer's having a hard time translating their language...
I can see where that would be a problem...
Hold on now. Let's stay together.
No wandering off --
Just stay put while I round up the others...
Let me try...
Come with me...
(pointing at the dress; to Tumak) Intaowa. Intaowa.
Dress. It's called a dress...
Intaowa.
Intaowa?
I'm afraid you'll have to put that back...
Vala. Vala!
Intaowa!
Do you like it... ?
Yes, it's very nice. But it's not yours...
That goes for you, too.
Major... perhaps you'd better handle this...
All right, let's put those back... both of you...

They really need to put those back... (a smile that takes in the dress and the display case) We can go shopping later. But right now it's important we go to the Infirmary... so all of you... follow me... We'll all go together...
Fazeek. Cromay fazeek!
Kootana...
Kootana batoo lakar asheem... !
(escalating; taking offense) Dokka?! Pestani voe lakar asheem!
(sharply; to Gai and Cowl) Kolat! Kolat kee!
There's no doubt who the boss is...
How bad is it, Doctor?
Looks like a second degree plasma burn. The dermal regenerator should take care of it...
I'm sorry... I'm not the doctor...
Kolat? Kolat Gadoux?
I assure, I won't hurt him...
He'll be all right...

This will be your quarters while you're here on the station. I'm sure you'd like to rest and clean up and... (catches herself as she sees their blank looks) ... you still don't understand a word I'm saying, do you...
I know something they might understand...
Seven maaza stalks...
This is food. Here -- try one --
Major, show them it's okay...
You see? It's really very good...
I'm glad you like them.
Noloux bataak rama setta... rama emal jeetaka... zeela koo... Gadoux soka gee...
I'm sorry... I don't understand...
Bataak rama setta... rama setta... zeela koo... hemena kee... soulak... need ikstassa...
Wait... did you hear that? I think she just said, "need."
(to Haneek, gentle enthusiasm) Go on... keep talking...
Ganoux? Noloux bataak rama setta... my people yeekopa Skrreea... havou fotar save them...
Save them! How? Can you understand what I'm saying?
Keep talking... !
Noloux Skrreea... soka roo need your help... there's no time soulak... we are the Skrreea... my people need your help... there's no time to waste...
You're people are the Skrreea. You need our help. There's no time to waste.
Your people... where are they?
They're on the creshnee side of the Eye...
The "Eye?"
The Eye of the Universe... The tunnel...
I think she means the wormhole.
They're on the other side... they don't realize that we've found the Eye...
How many people are we talking about?
(to Kira, a little war again) Many... three jeetaka.
Three hundred? Three thousand?
Three million?
(eyes Odo, then to Kira) Yes... three million... three million of my people are on the other side... we must bring them through the Eye... we must bring them here.
Is there anything wrong?
I'm just not used to the men being here... Skrreean men don't involve themselves in situations like this...
Are all your leaders women?
Yes.
All of them... ?
You heard her, Julian.
Men are much too emotional to be leaders. They're always fighting among themselves... it's their favorite thing to do. I'm sorry. I hope I haven't offended anyone...
Sorry to keep you waiting.
That's all right, Benjamin. Haneek was just telling us how the Skrreea are a female dominant society...
It seems the men are a bit too emotional to become leaders...
Please don't misunderstand... we love our men... (glancing around at the males) Really!
Are you one of the leaders of your people, Haneek?
Me? Oh no... I'm little more than a farmer... I was just lucky...
How so?
I was the first one to find the Eye of the Universe...
We had heard about a great tunnel being discovered... we knew it must be the Eye of the Universe that would lead us to Kentanna...
Kentanna?

Kentanna is the legendary home of the Skrreeans... it has always been portrayed in our sacred texts as being just beyond the Eye of the Universe... a "planet of sorrow where the Skrreea will sew seeds of joy."
I can't guarantee you'll find Kentanna, but I can promise you we'll help you find a home. I've sent our runabouts to the Gamma Quadrant to make contact with your ships.
That will be difficult... they're spread out, looking for the Eye...
When we do find them, what then? This station only holds seven thousand people... and you're talking about three million Skrreeans...
I'm afraid most of your people will have to stay confined to their ships...
I understand.
In the meantime, is there any one person we should be looking for? A leader... or leaders... ?
Most of our leaders were killed by the T-Rogorans.
The T-Rogorans? Who are they?
For eight centuries my people have lived under their rule... we were forced to work as laborers and servants... we were able to escape when the T-Rogorans were invaded and conquered...
Who conquered them?
I don't know their name. All I know is they were members of something called "The Dominion"...
Did I wake you?
It's all right. Please, come in...
Computer, lights on full.
I can come back later...
No. You've been so kind to me, how could I possibly refuse your company?
go back to bed. Go on! I'll join you again after I'm through...
Are those your... husbands?
Hus-bands? I'm not familiar with that word. They're bonded to me.
Do you... sleep with them... both?
Of course. Don't you sleep with your males?
No, I don't have any males... not at the moment, anyway...
They're very useful...

Yes, I imagine they are... (remembering why she's there) I just wanted to tell you, we found some of your ships. Several hundred Skrreeans should be arriving on the station today... we thought it would be a good idea if you were there to meet them.
Why me?
You yourself said most of your leaders were dead...
Yes, that's true... but I'm just a farmer...
You were also the first one through the Eye of the Universe... that must mean something, in a symbolic sort of way...
Oh... here. (hands package to Haneek) I brought you a little something.
Go ahead. Open it.
You seemed to like it...
I'm sorry... but I think you misunderstood...
What do you mean?
I thought this was the most hideous thing I'd ever seen.
Well, that makes two of us.
It's awful!
Horrible! Who would wear it?
Look -- it was no big deal --
You go out with a dabo girl for the first time and you stand there and tell me it was no big deal?
It's wasn't really a "date" --
Does your father know you went out with her?
Not exactly...
He doesn't?
I told him I had to go help someone with their homework...
Good thinking. Too bad I won't ever be able to use that lie. My dad knows I never do homework...
It's not a lie, Nog. Mardah's studying entomology. She asked me to help her out...
A dabo girl who studies entomology... ...sure.
It's true!
What is entomology?
The study of bugs.
You mean she wants to be a chef?
Hey -- who's that?
I don't know. What's he doing?
That's disgusting --
He must be one of the Skrreeans. My dad says there's a lot more of them on the way...
Hi!
Doesn't he know what a replicator's for? Idiot... So -- does Mardah have any sisters?
I've cleared the Skrreean ship to dock at upper pylon two.
Time to welcome your people to the Alpha Quadrant, Haneek...
Come on... don't be afraid... we're among friends...
scene: 29   INT. DOCKING RING CORRIDOR - OUTSIDE AIRLOCK

quote: Slow down!
There's no running on the Promenade!
It's going to get awfully crowded around here, Commander...
I know, Constable, but it's worth it. Just look at them... they're experiencing their first taste of freedom...
Nog! Where are you going?
Can't talk now! Gotta run!
Nog, you know there's no running on the Promenade...
Who's running?
What seems to be the problem?
(sniffing something sour) What's that smell... ?
(incensed, points at Nog) Ask him!
Me?! You're the one who stinks!
That's because you sprayed that vapor on us... !
Is that true, Nog?
No!
Nog... ?
It was a joke... !
Very amusing. (addressing the Skrreeans) Thank you for bringing this to my attention. I'll take care of it from here.
This isn't over yet, Big Ears!
Hey... here's a new one! What kind of name is "Plix Tixiplik?"
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: I believe he's a Reegrunion.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: "Wanted in seven star systems for illegal weapon sales." Weapon sales, huh? Very profitable.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: How would you know?
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: My Uncle Quark told me.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: What does your Uncle Quark know about illegal weapon sales?
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: He, uh... he, uh...
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: (finishing Nog's statement) ... knows better than to ever get involved in anything so disreputable...
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: (to Quark; dryly cynical) I'm sure. I asked the boy's father come see me...
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: Rom is doing the weekly stock inventory. I don't want to interrupt him. You know how easy he loses count... so I came in his place. Nog... have you been causing mischief again?
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: No, Uncle. It's all a misunderstanding.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: He sprayed some Skrreean boys with a foul-smelling vapor.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: Did he... (catching himself; to Nog; mock sternly) What do you have to say for yourself?
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: I'm sorry... ?
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: You see? The boy's beside himself with guilt.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: That still doesn't excuse his actions.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: And he will be punished. Severely.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: I will?
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: I want you to tell the Constable here that you'll never do it again.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: I won't? I mean, I won't. I promise. Never again.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG
33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: Can I leave now?
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: Go on.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: You know, you really can't blame the boy...
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: And why's that?
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: Come on, Odo... you know these Skrreeans are nothing but trouble. They're all over the station, looking and touching but never spending any money. And they flake.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: I didn't notice.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: Come to my place... you'll see little pieces of Skrreean skin all over the bar and the floor... it's disgusting.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: They won't be here long.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: I hope not. They're driving my paying customers away. They stay here too long and I'll be out of business...
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: In that case, I hope they never leave.
scene: 33A  INT. SECURITY OFFICE - ANGLE ON NOG

quote: We've talked it over among ourselves... our feelings were unanimous... you discovered the Eye of the Universe... you must lead us the rest of the way...
I'll do the best I can...
That looked pretty serious. Is everything all right?
Look at them... look at my people...
I've never seen them so happy...
... and here I sit, feeling trapped.
Why?
They expect me to lead them to Kentanna.
It's going to be okay. Commander Sisko's doing all he can to find you a place to live...
You're not alone.
I hope I'm not intruding...
Not at all... Haneek, this is Varani... a great musician... maybe the greatest Bajor has ever known...
She exaggerates... ... but that's why I'm so fond of her... Being a Bajoran, I know what it's like to be... displaced. As a token of friendship, I'd like to give you... this...
It's from a concert I gave many years ago... at the Jalanda Forum...
Tumak -- where've you been?
Nowhere...
Where are you going?
To wash...
Computer -- please show me a chart of this star system...
So what did your Dad say?
About what?
About your getting in trouble with Odo.
He was very angry.
He was?
He always gets angry when I get caught.
I just remembered... I've got errands to run for my uncle...
You're going to have to face them sooner or later...
You see, Jake? Now there's a man with a sense of humor...
Nobody's laughing.
And luckily nobody got hurt. I think my friend's sorry for what he did...
Aren't you, Nog...
I suppose...
See? What did I tell you?
He doesn't sound sorry to me...
I'm sorry! I'm sorry! I'm sorry!
All right, that's enough... break it up... I said, break it up!
It's bad enough all of you are hanging around the station without buying anything... you have to start fighting, too?
I thought we were welcome here...
Well make yourselves welcome somewhere else.
You don't want us here. You don't want anything to do with us. Well we don't want anything to do with you. Any of you!
I can see the Skrreean don't bother to teach their children manners...
Dax and I have been combing through data on every uninhabited M-Class planet in the sector...
We think Draylon Two would make a perfect home for the Skrreea.
(reading planet's name) "Draylon Two"... never heard of it...
It's near Sefalla Prime... it's got definite possibilities... stable orbit... a temperate climate... very low surface radiation...
Add to that good soil and a long growing season... I think it's our best bet.
May we come in?
scene: 44   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE GUEST QUARTERS - ON DOOR

quote: Of course...
scene: 44   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE GUEST QUARTERS - ON DOOR

quote: Ladies...
scene: 44   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE GUEST QUARTERS - ON DOOR

quote: Forgive them, Commander Sisko... they don't mean to be disrespectful...
scene: 44   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE GUEST QUARTERS - ON DOOR

quote: I understand. We have some encouraging news...
scene: 44   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE GUEST QUARTERS - ON DOOR

quote: We think we've found a planet for you and your people... one with excellent potential for resettlement.
scene: 44   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE GUEST QUARTERS - ON DOOR

quote: We appreciate all your hard work... but I'm afraid it was unnecessary... you see, we've found Kentanna.
scene: 44   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE GUEST QUARTERS - ON DOOR

quote: You have?
scene: 44   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE GUEST QUARTERS - ON DOOR

quote: A "planet of sorrow," Kira... don't you see? Kentanna is your planet... Kentanna is Bajor.
scene: 44   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE GUEST QUARTERS - ON DOOR

quote: Station log, Stardate 47391.2. Chief O'Brien is continuing to oversee repairs to the Skrreean ships docked at the station...
Meanwhile, Minister Rozahn and Vedek Sorad have arrived from Bajor with an official response to the Skrreeans' request to immigrate...
Major, if I may have a moment...
I'm sorry, Varani. I'm on my way to a meeting.
I know. With Minister Rozahn and Vedek Sorad. I suppose Haneek will be there as well...
That's right.
Please. Tell her my heart goes out to her and her people. Tell her how much Bajorans everywhere regret having to refuse their request.
Aren't you being a little premature?
Am I? You know what the provisional government's answer is going to be.
These are people who've lost everything, Varani...
I know. And I wish there was some way we could help them...
Bajor is in shambles, Kira... you know that as well as I...

First of all, I want you all to know that the provisional government has taken the Skrreeans' request for immigration very seriously. The debate in the Chamber of Ministers became quite heated at times... (attempt at humor to lighten the situation) Though I suppose you could say that about all of our debates...
But a decision was reached...
Yes. I was sent here to tell you that the Ministers -- -- in accord with the Vedek Assembly -- have decided to deny the Skrreeans' request.
(to Haneek; sympathetically) I'm sorry.
Bajor simply cannot absorb three million refugees at this time...
After what the Cardassians did to our planet, we can barely take care of our own.
But no one is asking you to take care of us... !
This decision is not based strictly on Bajoran self-interest. Such a huge increase in population would prove to be tragic to your people as well as ours.
But Bajor has more than enough room for us. The plains of the northwest peninsula are practically uninhabited. The land's ideal for farming.
It used to be... before the Cardassians got their hands on it.
Minister Rozahn, the Skrreeans are farmers... just give us the land... I guarantee you we can make it thrive again...

Under ideal circumstances, perhaps you could. But what if the circumstances aren't ideal? What if we go through another long winter? What if your crops fail? What if the famine that has been plaguing Bajor continues to spread? What then?
We're willing to take that risk...
We aren't. We ran a series of projections to see whether a Skrreean settlement could survive on the northwest peninsula. The results were not encouraging.
Haneek, I think you should seriously consider Draylon Two as an alternate to Bajor. The winters are mild, there's plenty of good farmland...
No! Projections can be wrong...
But what if they're not? What is Bajor to do if your people start dying?
I thought I made it clear. We're not expecting your help.
Do you really think we could stand by and do nothing? We'd feel obligated to help. With food, with clothing, with whatever it would take...
And where would that aid come from? Our resources are already depleted. To help you would mean depriving our own people.
I'm afraid the decision of the provisional government is final. The Skrreea will have to find somewhere else to live.
Talk to them... please... tell them that they're wrong...
Help us.
I can't.
I'm sorry, Haneek... but they're right. I wish they weren't... I wish Bajor was Kentanna... but it's not.
There's still Draylon Two.
If you like cake, the icoberry torte is really good...
(calm; surprisingly accessible) Icoberries... are they sweet or sour?
(surprised by Tumak's lack of anger) Both.
(nods... maybe he'll try some; beat) Is that big-eared troll really your friend?
Yeah.
He's an idiot.
You're not the first one to say that. But he's not such a bad guy... once you get to know him.
I don't plan on being here that long...
My dad says you're probably going to Draylon Two...
Does he...
Sounds like a pretty nice place...
Do you want to move there?
No...
Neither do I.
Come in...
Haneek...
The thing I don't understand is why you pretended to be my friend.
I wasn't pretending.
Ahhh. So you are my friend... ... until I need you.
I know it's hard for you to see right now, but I am trying to help...
I think I've had quite enough of your help...
You have to believe me, Commander Sisko has found you a wonderful home...
You betrayed me, Kira.
No, I didn't. I honestly believe the provisional government made the right decision, for both Bajor and the Skrreeans...
If that's true, then we have nothing to discuss.
I was hoping we could still be friends...
In other words, you came looking for forgiveness... Well I don't forgive you.
Sisko to Kira.
Go ahead, Commander.
Is Haneek with you?
Yes.
I need both of you in Ops immediately. Tumak has taken a ship. He's headed for Bajor...
They're not responding, sir...
Keep trying, Mister O'Brien...
How did it happen?

With all the traffic around the station, Tumak and two of his friends were able to slip away... we had no idea the ship was even gone until the Bajorans contacted us... Haneek, I need you to try to talk to your son...
(to Haneek; from his station) There's a high-energy radiation leak in the port nacelle. We've tried to make him aware of it, but he refuses to acknowledge us...
Major, open a channel to the Skrreean vessel...
Yes, sir. Ready.
Tumak... listen to me... your ship's in danger...
Have him turn off his engines and drift until the Bajorans can tractor him in...
Tumak... turn off your engines... you must turn off your engines now...
Mister O'Brien... ?
He's not responding...
Tumak, this is serious... your life's in danger... the others who are with you, their lives are in danger... please... answer me...
Sensors are detecting two Bajoran vessels closing in on the Skrreean ship...
On screen...
Mister O'Brien, patch us into the Bajoran interceptor.
Aye, sir.
... have entered restricted space... you must turn around and leave immediately...
Open a channel.
This is Major Kira Nerys on Deep Space Nine... the Skrreean vessel has refused to acknowledge our hails... it's possible their communications are down... you have to let them land...
That's impossible, Major... we have strict orders not to allow any Skrreean vessel to land...
But the pilot's just a boy... he's taken the ship without permission... It's barely operational. We're not sure he can get back here.
I'm sorry, Major, but we have our orders.
Who gave them to you?
They come directly from General Hazar.
Dax, get me General Hazar on Bajor... tell his people it's an emergency... I want to speak with him now...
Stand by, interceptor. General Hazar will be countermanding those orders any minute...
The interceptor's closing on the Skrreean ship...
It's General Hazar, Benjamin...
On screen...
What's this about, Commander?
It's about the Skrreean ship that's approaching Bajor...
I've already given orders to have it turned back...
That ship is being flown by a child... and it's leaking radiation...
A child... ?
... Skrreean ship. Repeating: return to the space station now.
Have him shut down his engines. We'll tow him back...
Tumak, please... turn off your engines...
Interceptor One, what's going on?
They've opened fire on us... taking evasive action...
Tumak! Don't do this!
He's pursuing... we've been hit... !
Commander -- they're returning fire...
Disengage, interceptor! Repeat: disengage!
General, tell you pilots to hold
I'm relaying that order now...
Interceptor One... ?
The Skrreean ship exploded. I didn't even think we hit it...
The phaser beam must've ignited the radiation leak...
Commander... I'm so sorry...
We all are, General...
I just came by to wish you luck on Draylon Two.
Haneek, I still believe this is the best choice... for Bajor and for you.
And you believe we would have been a burden to your people...
Yes.

(nods; it's the answer she expected) I think you've made a terrible mistake. All of you. Maybe we could have helped you. Maybe we could have helped each other. The Skrreeans are farmers, Kira. You have a famine on your planet. We might have made that peninsula bloom again. We'll never know, will we?
Fifty years of Cardassian rule has made you all frightened and suspicious. I feel sorry for you.
You were right. Bajor is not Kentanna.

Station log, Stardate 47182.1. DS- Nine has been temporarily evacuated due to a violent plasma disruption in the Denorios Belt. Until the disturbance ends, we'll be forced to maintain the station with a skeleton crew.
How are we holding up?
So far, so good. I'll say one thing for the Cardassians, they built this place to last.
And just in case it doesn't, I've got the Orinoco prepped and ready at Pad "C."
Any word from Chief O'Brien?
He and Odo checked in about an hour ago. They sealed off the airlocks in the upper and lower pylons and were moving on to the docking ring.
Sisko to O'Brien.
O'Brien here.
What's your status, Chief?

Almost done, Commander. We've sealed all the airlocks on Levels Twenty- One, Twenty-Two and Twenty-Three, but we still have to check the outer bulkheads to make sure there hasn't been any crystallization from the plasma discharges... Shouldn't take much longer.
I thought you might like to know... we received a message from Bajor just before the plasma storm cut off communications. The shuttle with your family aboard arrived safely.
Yes, sir. Thank you. O'Brien out.
Did you hear that?
Hear what?
I could've sworn I heard something.
Quark.
What are you doing here? You're under strict orders from Sisko not to leave the bar.
I'm not a prisoner, Odo. I volunteered to stay and help you protect the station.

The only reason you "volunteered" was because there wasn't any room on the evacuation shuttles for six hundred bars of gold-pressed latinum. Which still doesn't explain what you're doing out here in the docking ring.
I was saying good-bye to my brother.
Your brother? His shuttle left three hours ago.
Funny, it's only been three hours... and I'm already lost without him...
Oh, please. Don't try to tell me you've been sitting here all this time pining for Rom.
I know, I know. He couldn't find a cup of water if you dropped him in a lake... but even if he is an idiot, he's still my brother...
And you'd betray him in a second if it suited your interests.
But that doesn't mean I don't love him... Chief, do you have any brothers?
(not sure what Quark is getting at) As a matter of fact, I have two...
And did you ever have to say good-bye to them?
Sure, when I joined Starfleet...
And did it bring a tear to your eye?
I suppose it did.
(triumphant, gestures to Odo) Well try explaining that to him.
The storm's intensity is up thirty- seven percent.
Is there any way to tell how long it'll last?
Your guess is as good as mine. Plasma storms are extremely rare. But look on the bright side, this gives us a great opportunity to study one.
Lucky us.
You should see the view from the Promenade. Simply amazing.
I assume the Promenade is secure.
Yes sir. I've struck the sails and battened the hatches... so to speak.
Benjamin... You'd better look at this.
I'm detecting a small vessel headed this way at one quarter impulse.
They're hailing us.
On screen.
I can't get a visual.
... cargo ship Ekina. We've been caught by the storm. Our engines have been severely damaged. We need emergency assistance. Can you read me? Repeat, this is the cargo ship Ekina...
I've lost it.
Can you get a transporter lock on the crew?
There's too much interference.
Engage the tractor beam. Bring them into the closest docking bay.
It's not working. The plasma storm is dispersing the beam.
Maybe if we modulate the frequency of the beam...
I've got them. But I don't know how long I can hold on.
Bring them into docking bay five.
There might be casualties. I'll get down to the Infirmary.
(nods to Bashir; to com) Sisko to O'Brien.
O'Brien here.
We've got some storm victims coming into docking bay five. They may be in need of assistance.
I'll have to release the emergency seals on the airlock before they can board the station. On my way.
Stand clear.
Are you all right? Is anyone hurt?
Not yet.
What the hell do you think you're doing?
(gestures toward the airlock door) No questions. Into the corridor.
This is a fine way of showing your gratitude. We just saved your lives out there.
You see? The ever-helpful Federation. So predictable.
Listen here, friend... in case you
The Empire is governed by doddering fools and frightened old women who aren't worthy of the name Klingon. Mareel, the combadges.
This one must be the shape-shifter.
Go on, what are you waiting for?
You're a Trill.
Inside.
And what if I refuse?
Please. Do as he says and no one will get hurt.
Now, shifter. Or this one dies.
Let's go... Ally.
Were there any casualties?
That depends on you.
Yeto, get the Ferengi.
You mind telling me what this is all about?
Any more questions?
Don't hurt him.
Mareel, the box.
Put it in your stasis chamber.
Now. Or I will destroy it.
Is that supposed to be some kind of threat?
They've got Odo in there.
I see... In that case...
I'm still not getting a response from O'Brien or Odo.
Run a level three security scan.
Don't bother.
Please... take your hands away from the controls.
Now. (gestures with his disruptor) To the center of the room.
Do as he says.
Don't worry, Verad. Everything's going to be all right.
Get with the others.
Your turn, little man.
Don't forget to disable the backups as well as the primary systems.
It's my fault, Commander. They took us by surprise. Somehow, they must have neutralized the security systems in the docking ring.
And how did they manage that?
I'm not sure. But I've got a pretty good idea. We ran across Quark in an airlock a little while ago.
When this is over, Quark and I are going to have a little "talk."
Do you know him?
Ah, Yeto... It's such a pleasure doing business with Klingons. You're so... punctual.
I see that your ship was "rescued" according to plan. I've got your merchandise right here... but I don't see any latinum.
(shakes his head in disgust) You Ferengi... you think you're so clever... but you're stupid.
Now, now. There's no need for name calling. If you don't want these liquid data chains, I'm sure I can line up dozens of other buyers.
Go right ahead.
Yeto... this is no time to haggle for a better deal. Where else are you going to get data chains of this quality for such a reasonable price?
You can keep your data chains...
Don't be ridiculous... You expect me to believe you've come all this way, braved the storm, just to tell me the deal is off?
Stupid Ferengi.
I said no one moves.
I'm the commander of this station. What's your business here?
You'll have to ask my employer.
I... I'm sorry about this. If everyone would just cooperate, I promise this will all be over soon.
What will be over soon?
This is an outrage. I demand that you release me at once.
Enough of your whining.
Who are these people? What do they want with us?
Funny, I was just about to ask you that.
That's enough.
I agree. Now tell me what you want here.
Dax. I want Dax.
She's not going anywhere with you.
No, no. I... I don't want the girl. I only want what is rightfully mine... what should have been mine years ago. I want Dax.
The symbiont, Benjamin. He's come to steal my symbiont.
You can't remove Jadzia's symbiont. If you do, she'll die.
He knows that, Doctor.
I'm sorry. Please believe me, I wish I didn't have to do this.
Then don't.

I don't have any choice. I spent my whole life trying to qualify for the joining. I studied constantly... every day... every waking hour... I sacrificed everything... And then I went before the Symbiosis Evaluation Board... and they reduced my entire life to one word... "Unsuitable... "
That's nothing to be ashamed of. Neither of my parents or my sister underwent symbiosis. And they lead happy and productive lives. Only one Trill in ten is chosen to be joined.
That's easy for you to say. They chose you.
I was one of the lucky ones.
And now it's Verad's turn to be lucky.
But why Dax? There are thousands of symbionts on Trill. Why her?
I did research... I worked it all out... The Dax symbiont is the best match for me. We have mutual interests in science... diplomacy...
There's another reason, isn't there?
The wormhole. Once you've stolen the symbiont, you plan on escaping into the Gamma Quadrant, don't you?
Can you think of a better place to start a new life?

I understand your frustration... But there could be dozens of reasons why the Board didn't select you for symbiosis. They have to be very careful. An improper joining can cause permanent psychological damage... to both the symbiont and the host. They were just looking after your best interests.

Your best interests, maybe... but not mine. All they've done is condemn me to a life of mediocrity... Well, I refuse to accept it. I won't spend the rest of my life dreaming about what I could have been... what I should have been. I deserve more. And I'm going to get it.
Yeto, T'Kar. It's time.
I'll have no part in this.
I... I understand.
Keep away from him.
There. You see? I've taken the first step. Even if I don't get what I want, my life is over. So either you help me... or you and your friends will die. It's your choice.
He'll help. I don't want anyone else hurt because of me. But you have to give me your word that no one else on the station will be harmed.
I promise. Doctor.
Do as he says, Julian. Please.
Let me treat Chief O'Brien's phaser wound first. (sees Verad's reluctance) It won't take long.
There's an emergency medical kit under that console.
Hold still.
There. There should be no permanent damage.
Apply this every twenty minutes or so. It'll help the wound regenerate.
Enough stalling. Take them to the Infirmary.
Do as he says, Doctor. This is no time to be a hero.
This isn't over, Dax. I promise you that.
Dax...
(anticipating what he's going to say) I know, Benjamin... you'll do all you can. But just in case it isn't enough, I want you to know... (beat, searches for the words, smiles) It's been fun.
Good luck.
It won't be long now. And then you'll see. Everything will be just as I promised.
I know.
What's that?
It's a delta wave inducer. It will keep you asleep through the surgery. It also increases your body's natural endorphin production to help accelerate the healing process.
I don't want it.
I strongly advise that you use it... the surgery will be much easier on you if you...

I don't need your advice. I want to be awake. Use a neuro-electrical suppressor. And set up a monitor so I can watch the procedure. That way, if you run into any "trouble," I'll be able to assist you. Now let's get started.
And if I refuse.
Verad to Mareel.
Is there a problem?
That's up to the doctor. Will you cooperate? Or do I tell Mareel to shoot the hostages? Who should she start with... The Bajoran... or maybe your commander...
No. That won't be necessary.
Good. No more games. If I don't survive this, neither will they. Did you hear that, Mareel?
I heard. Mareel out.
Now, Doctor...
I'm sorry, Jadzia.
Don't blame yourself, Julian. You did all you could.
I... This will help you sleep.
Thank you.
Forgive me...
How long can Jadzia survive without the symbiont?
Once the symbiont's removed, the host usually dies within hours. But Jadzia's young and healthy... Bashir will do all he can... She'll make it through the night.
That still doesn't give us much time...
No talking.
I don't want to kill you, Commander... but I will.
You had your chance.
This is ridiculous. Don't you realize they're going to kill us? What are you people sitting around for? Do something.
Do you have any suggestions?
Why should I have any suggestions? I'm not the military mastermind. I'm just a victim of circumstances.
A victim? Really? Then maybe you'd like to tell me how four armed terrorists got past the docking ring security grid.
Security grid? I don't know what you're talking...
Save it, Quark. You've crossed the line this time.
You sold us out, and Dax may die because of it. Whatever happens next, one thing's certain... You're through here.
Are you all right?
I'll live.
Don't try that again. I don't want to have to hurt anyone.
Tell that to Jadzia.
That's different.
